meanings.definition: A person or thing that rouses or stirs up excitement or enthusiasm.
meanings.sent1: The energetic cheerleader was a real rouser at the game, getting everyone excited.
meanings.sent2: The concert was a real rouser, with the crowd cheering and clapping loudly.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's playful antics were a rouser, making everyone smile and laugh.
meanings.sent4: The surprise party was a rouser, catching everyone off guard and full of excitement.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks display was a rouser, lighting up the night sky with bursts of color.

meanings.definition: A loud noise or disturbance that wakes someone up.
meanings.sent1: The thunderstorm outside was a sudden rouser, waking everyone in the house.
meanings.sent2: The alarm clock served as a reliable rouser every morning, ensuring he woke up on time.
meanings.sent3: The barking dog next door was a constant rouser, interrupting their peaceful sleep.
meanings.sent4: The fire alarm blaring was a necessary rouser, alerting everyone to evacuate the building.
meanings.sent5: The noisy garbage truck passing by was an early morning rouser, disrupting the quiet street.

meanings.definition: To wake someone up or stir them from sleep.
meanings.sent1: She gently rousered her brother from his nap, so they could play together.
meanings.sent2: The loud noise outside rousered the entire household from their slumber.
meanings.sent3: The smell of pancakes cooking rousered him from his deep sleep with a growling stomach.
meanings.sent4: The urgent phone call rousered her from a peaceful dream, leaving her disoriented.
meanings.sent5: The bright sunlight streaming through the window rousered her awake, signaling the start of a new day.
